result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: CK # 14C 027406 - Issued to pay restitution determined for 14CF112 - Amount for RHT was assessed in 12CF189 due to 14CF112 charges dismissed.
Restitution to be paid for this case assessed in 12CF189 and bond applied from 12CF319 as 14CF112 was dismissed. Check issued to DA Office.

Def called inquiring about getting some of her bond back so she will be able to get her driver's license.  She stated that while in court it was stated that the fine/costs would come out of the $3,000.00 bond (posted by Warren Nelson) first.  I read her the exact wording in the court record that "We will apply what is needed and remainder to be rfunded to appropriate party.  No PP needed".  She would like to be contacted when money is ready to be refunded. Told her that court has 14 days to finish her cases and refund any remaining bond.  NOTE: Warren Nelson, poster of $3,000.00  stopped at COC counter on 8-5-14 to request COC to call him when money is to be refunded so he can pick it up.

CASES: 12CF189, 12CF310 (12CF319, 12CF358, 14CF112) Defendant Jodi E Halverson in court with attorney Kirk M. Anderson.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 10:46am CT notes errors in PSI. 

12CF189
Ct 2- w/h sent, prob 1 yr, concurrent w/ other files, $265.60 fines/costs. 200 hrs of CS complete by 50 hrs each year for 1st four years of prob.   

12CF310
Ct 1- w/h sent, prob 7yrs,  as a cond of prob- 1 yr in PCJ- 60 days upfront starting 1/2/2015 balance of 10 mos banked to be used by prob agent should be necessary, $290.60 fines/cost. Can serve jail time in MN- as long as at no cost to PC and must be jail time not electronic monitoring. Cond'l time not sub to GT but is sub to Huber. 

Ct 2- w/h sent, prob 5 yrs, $290.60 fines/cost, no add'l time. 

Ct 3- w/h sent, prob 3 yrs, $290.60 fines/cost. 

14CF112- restitution of $250 + $25 surcharge total $275. 

All probation to run concurrent. 

Atty Anderson- bond payments? CT- Bond to be applied-  12CF310 there is $250  and 12CF319 there is $300- motion to forfeit bond- motions granted. In 12CF358 $3800- that motion is denied. We will apply what is needed and remainder to be refunded to appropriate party. No PP needed. 

Cannot possess firearms or body armor, cannot vote or hold public office. 
CT- AODA assess & comply with recomm. mental health assess and comply, subject to random testing and compliance.  11:55am

CASES: 12CF189, 12CF310, 12CF319, 12CF358 & 14CF112. Defendant Jodi E Halverson in court with attorney Kirk M Anderson. Kenneth Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 8:50.  14CF112-def represented by atty Shirlene Perrin who also appears.  
12CF189-Count 2-Def-guilty.  12CF310-Count 1-Def-guilty.  Count 2-Def-guilty.  Count 3-guilty.  CT-accept pleas, adj guilty & enter JOC.  DRI count 1 in 12CF189.  DRI Counts 1&2 of 12CF319.  DRI count 1 of 12CF358.  DRI counts 1 thru 9 of 14CF112 for sentencing.  Convicted felon, cannot possess firearm, cannot vote, cannot possess body armor, if not a US citizen face deportation.  
Cap at range of PSI.  ADA-will not argue for consecutive time between 12CF189 & 12CF310.  Dept to specify as to consecutive/concurrent recommendation.  PSI-longform, filed not later than 7/25 at noon.  Agent need not be present.  Must provide DNA sample at jail.  Def states she has done that back in 2000.  Def to stop at probation today.  Bond cont.  9:17 am adj.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Party Address Sealed by Judge GaleWyrick
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Not to have contact with: Brandtjen Kluge Manufacturing - 539 South Blanding Woods, St. Croix Falls, WI - Must follow all conditons in other open files.
